meanings.definition: To beat or whip with a leather strap.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was tawsing the rug to remove the dust.
meanings.sent2: She tawsed the dough to make it smooth and elastic.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the tawsing of the old carpet.
meanings.sent4: The wind tawsed the leaves off the trees in a dance.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic tawsing of the drum echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A punishment or discipline involving a leather strap.
meanings.sent1: The principal used tawsing as a last resort for discipline.
meanings.sent2: The tawsing left a mark on his back as a reminder.
meanings.sent3: The tawsing of the naughty puppy was more playful than serious.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a tawsing to his conscience, making him reflect.
meanings.sent5: The tawsing of the waves against the shore was calming.
